headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval

issue.title: remote module don't work with ES6 class methods

comment.body:
@zcbenz Yeah, it's a surprise to me too. For now I can just use prototypes or reconfigure the properties. However to me it seems that it's necessary to provide some long term solution for this since eventually people will start using ES6 syntax and class is a nice feature to group functionalities.

One idea, is that possible to also include those non-enumerable own properties that are functions?
There is a stackoverflow answer here demonstrate some similar ideas:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/31054910/get-functions-of-a-class

However I think this does need some consideration and discussion.

issue.title: Dialog: showErrorBox or entire API can be called before ready?
issue.body:
>This API can be called safely before the ready event the app module emits, it is usually used to report errors in early stage of startup. If called before the app readyevent on Linux, the message will be emitted to stderr, and no GUI dialog will appear.

This at the end after the `showErrorBox` summary. Does it apply to the whole API? I know it says "API" but just want to be safe.

issue.title: Dialog: showErrorBox or entire API can be called before ready?
issue.body:
>This API can be called safely before the ready event the app module emits, it is usually used to report errors in early stage of startup. If called before the app readyevent on Linux, the message will be emitted to stderr, and no GUI dialog will appear.

This at the end after the `showErrorBox` summary. Does it apply to the whole API? I know it says "API" but just want to be safe.

comment.body: Only showErrorBox can be called before the ready event.

issue.title: Module version mismatch when using webFrame.setSpellCheckProvider example.
issue.body:
[Electron webFrame docs]:https://github.com/atom/electron/blob/master/docs/api/web-frame.md
[Electron quickstart project]:https://github.com/atom/electron-quick-start

Apologies in advance if this is an issue in the spellchecker project.

The [Electron webFrame docs] have the following example for using this plugin:

```
webFrame.setSpellCheckProvider("en-US", true, {
  spellCheck: function(text) {
    return !(require('spellchecker').isMisspelled(text));
  }
});
```

Using this example results in the following error: 
```
App threw an error when running [Error: Module version mismatch. Expected 47, got 46.]
```

Additionally I was able to reproduce on the [Electron quickstart project] after cloning the project:
```
npm install --save spellchecker
npm install && npm start
```

Thanks for any assistance in advance.

comment.body:
Native modules have to be compiled against Electron's headers.
http://electron.atom.io/docs/v0.36.0/tutorial/using-native-node-modules/

issue.title: dialog.showMessageBox: `cancelId` clarification
issue.body:
Sorry for all the issues, doing a bit of research into the APIs :). So, `cancelId` has this description:

>`cancelId` Integer - The value will be returned when user cancels the dialog instead of clicking the buttons of the dialog. By default it is the index of the buttons that have "cancel" or "no" as label, or 0 if there is no such buttons. On OS X and Windows the index of "Cancel" button will always be used as cancelId, not matter whether it is already specified.

If you don't have a `cancel` or `no` button and `0` is used, will the callback be called with `1` if your first button is clicked, `2` if the second is clicked, and so on?

Also, about this bit:

>On OS X and Windows the index of "Cancel" button will always be used as cancelId, not matter whether it is already specified.

What happens if there is no `Cancel` button?

issue.title: dialog.showMessageBox: `cancelId` clarification
issue.body:
Sorry for all the issues, doing a bit of research into the APIs :). So, `cancelId` has this description:

>`cancelId` Integer - The value will be returned when user cancels the dialog instead of clicking the buttons of the dialog. By default it is the index of the buttons that have "cancel" or "no" as label, or 0 if there is no such buttons. On OS X and Windows the index of "Cancel" button will always be used as cancelId, not matter whether it is already specified.

If you don't have a `cancel` or `no` button and `0` is used, will the callback be called with `1` if your first button is clicked, `2` if the second is clicked, and so on?

Also, about this bit:

>On OS X and Windows the index of "Cancel" button will always be used as cancelId, not matter whether it is already specified.

What happens if there is no `Cancel` button?

comment.body:
> If you don't have a cancel or no button and 0 is used, will the callback be called with 1 if your first button is clicked, 2 if the second is clicked, and so on?

The callback will be called with button's index when button is clicked, so 0 for 1st button. 

> What happens if there is no Cancel button?

Then it would follow the `cancelId`.

[The community](https://github.com/atom/electron#community) is usually a better place for this kind of questions, and the best way is to try it yourself.

issue.title: sending keyboard events serially
issue.body:
It appears that `sendInputEvent` (https://github.com/atom/electron/issues/2269) is an asynchronous event. This is causing problems if you'd like to type more than one character into a text box (see https://github.com/segmentio/nightmare/issues/414 for more information).

Is there anyway to execute these events serially or provide a callback or something when the input event has finished?

comment.body: @zcbenz yikes, do you have any idea how we could send a word? as it stands, we can only send individual characters and those characters are not guaranteed to be in the proper order. this seems like it highly limits the usefulness of sendEvent :-/

issue.title: Disable caching in webview
issue.body:
Hi,
   As per this issue #891 **disable chrome BrowserWindow caching**, there is a new flag `--disable-http-cache` introduced to disable caching. But it still caches the content in webview.

I have a embedded http server running inside the electron app, which renders static html(from the directory ) into the webview. So the process is simple, when the user exits the presentation to open another one, it exits the server and open the http in another directory. But some presentation has the files with the same names & extensions. This led chrome to cache its content.

Another interesting issue i found with webview is, it aggressively caches even if i append a cachebuster string  to the url. But the same link with the cachebuster key works fine in the chrome browser(regular mode). So it's an issue in webview only.

So summarize, these are the 2 issues i have encountered regarding webview cache
   1. webview still caches even if there is a `--disable-http-cache` switch
   2. It  caches even with the cachebuster query string in the url

Hope i made this clear. Let me know if you need more info.

Cheers

comment.body: Same issue...

issue.title: Takes 20+ seconds to Load Electron on Win 7 SP1
issue.body:
While trying to use Visual Studio Code on my work computer, I experienced very long load times.  Here is a link to the [Issue I opened on the VSCode repo](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1855) which contains more details.

As part of my troubleshooting, I tried running Electron by itself and experience 20 second loading times.  I tried several versions from [mafintosh/electron-prebuilt](https://github.com/mafintosh/electron-prebuilt) and get the same result.

Attached are the CPU profiles captured from VS Code when doing a window reload.  If there are ways to capture the profiles while launching Electron, I'd be happy to do that.

[CPU-20160108T102601.zip](https://github.com/atom/electron/files/85843/CPU-20160108T102601.zip)

*System Specs*
 * Windows 7 Enterprise SP1
 * Intel i5-4590, 8GB RAM, Samsung 950Pro SSD
 * On a corporate network which forces us to use Symantec Endpoint.  I don't believe Symantec is the cause because VSCode launched quickly on our servers which also run Symantec.  This problem seems exclusive to our Win 7 machines.

comment.body:
As much as I dislike Symantec Endpoint, I don't believe it is the cause.  It's processes show no significant CPU or disk utilization during the startup of Electron or VS Code according to profiles I recorded with Windows Performance Recorder.

This is backed up by our Win Server 2008 machines having no issues with Electron, despite having Endpoint with the same definitions installed.

issue.title: `autoUpdater.quitAndInstall` does not cause application to emit normal quit events
issue.body: When `app.quit` is called, `app` will emit `'before-quit'`, `'will-quit'`, and so on. When the application is quit by calling `autoUpdater.quitAndInstall`, these events are not emitted.

comment.body:
We also just ran into this problem, and are having quite a bit of trouble getting `quitAndInstall` to work at all. Currently all windows are being closed, but the app never quits. We've checked all our code to make sure nothing's preventing it from quitting, but since no `before-quit` or `will-quit` events are being emitted, it's difficult to debug.

+1 on making the behavior consistent with Windows.

issue.title: Create transparent window on top of everything
issue.body:
Is it possible to create a full-screen transparent window on top of all running applications, dock, menubar (on OSX) an everything else with BrowserWindow or I have to hack around with Electron sources?

I believe this has something to do with window level (https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Cocoa/Reference/ApplicationKit/Classes/NSWindow_Class/#//apple_ref/doc/constant_group/Window_Levels), but I could not make what I want with BrowserWindow, so I'm asking here.

comment.body:
Just figured out how to achieve this. The key thing is to set window level ```[window_ setLevel:NSScreenSaverWindowLevel];```, cocoa_bounds to size of screen ```cocoa_bounds = [NSScreen mainScreen].frame;``` and ```setEnableLargerThanScreen``` to ```true```. Also blocking of moving and resizing is recommended.

I'll think of the best way to add this to Electron and send you a pull request.

issue.title: Flash content protected with Adobe Access DRM not playable under Windows
issue.body:
Flash videos that use DRM will play in Electron under Mac, but not Windows.  On Windows, Flash returns error 3364, which appears to be due to Flash not getting a "Device ID" from the browser when it requests one. https://forums.adobe.com/thread/1938250?start=0&tstart=0

I am able to play DRM videos in nw.js on both platforms (using the NPAPI Flash Player).

The issue seems to be referenced here: https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=568249

The interesting comment is  # 6 in the Chromium bug report.

```
I assume you have enable_rlz=1 in your build?
```

I do not know much about Chromium's source, but it looks like all the code associated with generating a "Device ID" is wrapped in a `#if defined(ENABLE_RLZ)`.

I am assuming Electron's Chromium build does not have this flag enabled.  I am not sure how to verify that or how to go about enabling the flag if that is indeed the case.

Any help is much appreciated.

issue.title: [WIP] Convert from CoffeeScript to JavaScript
issue.body:
This pull request migrates all of the CoffeeScript source files to JavaScript.

:chart_with_upwards_trend: CoffeeScript was great when this project started, but many of the best parts of it are now in ES6 and available out of the box in Electron. See [this blog post](http://blog.atom.io/2016/01/07/latest-v8-chromium-features.html) for some examples.

:coffee: The JavaScript files in this pull request were generated using CoffeeScript `1.10.0`.  A second pass will be made in a follow-up pull request to reformat the JavaScript and draft a new styleguide. This is done to minimally disrupt any open or soon to be opened pull requests that may touch the existing `.coffee` files.

:memo: The comments have been retained by first migrating all the `#` comments to `###` which were then compiled to `/* */` style comments in the JavaScript.

:dart: The goal is to make Electron as approachable as possible and also to have its source code reflect the capabilities of the V8 version being used.

### Changes to be made in subsequent pull requests

  - Cleanup accidental `return` statements
  - Cleanup comment formatting
  - Cleanup variable scoping
  - Remove CoffeeScript helpers like `extend`, `slice`, and `indexOf`
  - Use `let` and `const` appropriately
  - Use arrow (`=>`) functions

comment.body: Keep going' :+1: :sunglasses:

issue.body:
This pull request migrates all of the CoffeeScript source files to JavaScript.

:chart_with_upwards_trend: CoffeeScript was great when this project started, but many of the best parts of it are now in ES6 and available out of the box in Electron. See [this blog post](http://blog.atom.io/2016/01/07/latest-v8-chromium-features.html) for some examples.

:coffee: The JavaScript files in this pull request were generated using CoffeeScript `1.10.0`.  A second pass will be made in a follow-up pull request to reformat the JavaScript and draft a new styleguide. This is done to minimally disrupt any open or soon to be opened pull requests that may touch the existing `.coffee` files.

:memo: The comments have been retained by first migrating all the `#` comments to `###` which were then compiled to `/* */` style comments in the JavaScript.

:dart: The goal is to make Electron as approachable as possible and also to have its source code reflect the capabilities of the V8 version being used.

### Changes to be made in subsequent pull requests

  - Cleanup accidental `return` statements
  - Cleanup comment formatting
  - Cleanup variable scoping
  - Remove CoffeeScript helpers like `extend`, `slice`, and `indexOf`
  - Use `let` and `const` appropriately
  - Use arrow (`=>`) functions

comment.body: woop to this :+1:

comment.body: It would be useful to have a userland module that implement this. @alexandrudima if you'll write one, you can find my [debug-menu](https://github.com/parro-it/debug-menu) module useful as an example. Otherwise, I could develop it...

issue.title: No Cut/Copy/Paste context menus on <input> fields
issue.body: From Microsoft/vscode#1578 * Tried in Electron v0.35.6 * Edit the default app `index.html` * Add a ` ``` * Righit click > Observe, no context menu appears: --- ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/12263146/223277de-b92d-11e5-8600-1ec2fef718ad.png)

comment.body:
Only devtools has context menu by default in Electron, for all other elements you have to implement the menus on your own. It would be nice to have default context menu for native input elements though.

Refs #3210.
